subject: Creativity
title: Exposition Through Dialogue: The Info-Dump Problem
description: A micro-lesson that makes Exposition Through Dialogue: The Info-Dump Problem usable.

hook.text: 'As you know, Bob, our company was founded in 1987...' Nobody talks like this.

buildup.text: The challenge: readers need information. But characters shouldn't explain things they both already know for the reader's sake.

discovery.text: The fix: characters reveal information through conflict. A detective interrogating a suspect naturally extracts.

twist.text: Aaron Sorkin hides exposition in arguments. By the time you realize you learned something, you're too entertained to.

climax.text: 'Show don't tell' applies to dialogue too. Let readers piece together the world from fragments ‚Äî like eavesdropping on.

punchline.text: If dialogue sounds like a Wikipedia entry, rewrite it as a fight.

quiz.question: What is the 'As you know, Bob' problem in writing?
options: Characters explaining things they both already know for the reader's benefit
